emission.emission_notes: Kaspa uses continuous geometric decay (not discrete halvings). Monthly reduction factor: (1/2)^(1/12) = 0.94387 (5.6% monthly decrease). This creates a chromatic scale pattern in emission reduction. Pre-deflationary phase (Nov 7-May 8, 2022): 500 KAS/sec constant. Chromatic phase (May 2022-~2058): Smooth exponential decay.

cost_to_mine_one_unit.notes: Oct 2025 ASIC era: KS5 Pro at $0.10/kWh. GPU era (Nov 2021-July 2023): costs were $0.0001-0.0003/KAS, representing 100-300x profit margin. Early DAGLabs mining cost was fraction of GPU retail prices due to wholesale cloud infrastructure rates.

decentralization.top_5_pools_note: Current (Oct 2025): f2pool 23%, viabtc 22%, humpool 21%, whalepool 6%, k1pool 6%. Source: https://miningpoolstats.stream/kaspa. Historical comparison shows significant decentralization improvement from Dec 2021 peak of 74% in single pool (Poolflare).

largest_pool_historical.name: Poolflare
largest_pool_historical.note: Historical data showing major improvement in decentralization over time

decentralization.nakamoto_note: Minimum 4 pools needed for 51% attack (improved from historical 2-3). This represents significant decentralization progress.

market_data.recent_high_context: Following Binance futures and staking integration announcement

notes: CRITICAL: First 6 months of blockchain history (Nov 2021 - May 2022) permanently missing - 7.8 billion KAS (27% of supply, $410M current value) cannot be verified as fairly distributed
No technical pre-mine (0 KAS allocated before genesis), but substantial structural insider advantages during early GPU mining phase

DAGLabs was dissolved shortly after mainnet launch in November 2021 per official sources; Polychain Capital and Polychain have waived intellectual property rights. Kaspa is now a community-run project.
Network restart at day 14 (Nov 22, 2021) resulted in loss/reset of ~648M KAS mined in first 14 days; incident undisclosed for years (only revealed in 2024 Twitter exchange)
Ex-VP of Bitmain (Gadi Glickberg) joined DAGLabs 7 months before launch - represented unprecedented hardware expertise and potential access to manufacturing capacity
BitcoinTalk announcement delayed 19 days after launch and 7 days after network restart - public mining community had delayed visibility compared to informed insiders
20-month GPU-only mining period (Nov 2021 - July 2023) before ASIC availability allowed organized entities with capital and hardware expertise to prepare mining operations
Developer transparency failures: Questioned investigator was kicked from Discord and question deleted; missing data acknowledged only when confronted with technical analysis
Forensic team admitted hijacking attack was technically feasible without full nodes - attack vector would allow theft during missing data period (Nov 2021 - May 2022)
Multiple user reports of missing coins (disappearing without visible outgoing transactions) during the missing blockchain data period; claims unverified due to data gap
Mining profitability at $0.0591/KAS: ASIC miners at cost of $0.038/KAS showing healthy 55% margin at $0.10/kWh electricity. Negative margins only above $0.12/kWh.
Pool decentralization significantly improved: Oct 2025 top 5 pools = 78% combined (f2pool 23%, viabtc 22%, humpool 21%, whalepool 6%, k1pool 6%) vs. Dec 2021 peak of 74% in single pool (Poolflare)
Kaspa blockchain continues autonomous operation with active community development. No central authority extraction post-DAGLabs dissolution.
